top_categories.workout_context: MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic’s gravel roads, forest tracks demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
At 93 miles, MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic. Make this intensity feel like home.
MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic’s high country gravel and forest tracks and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic’s 8,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
Every session at MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic’s 8,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.
Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on high country gravel and forest tracks.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic’s 93 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at MAAP Beechworth Granite Classic requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on high country gravel and forest tracks to build confidence. Expect: gravel roads, forest tracks, high country terrain.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Over Under, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 93 miles of high country gravel and forest tracks in Beechworth, Victoria.
